title-group.article-title: Short Effective Intervals Containing Primes in Arithmetic Progressions and the Seven Cubes Problem

abstract.p: For any ϵ > 0 and any non- exceptional modulus q ≥ 3, we prove that, for x large enough <tex-math>$(x \ge \alpha _ \in \log ^2 q),$</tex-math> the interval <tex-math>$[e^x ,e^{x + \in } ]$</tex-math> contains a prime p in any of the arithmetic progressions modulo q. We apply this result to establish that every integer n larger than exp(71000) is a sum of seven cubes.
